Article Title: ‘Kochi Biennale challenges the practice of putting certain artists on a pedestal’
Article Text:
Nikhil Chopra

You were one of the OGs of

performance art

in India, back when it wasn’t even widely accepted as art. You’ve done things like eating and sleeping at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York to trace the legacy of colonialism. As curator, the Biennale feels like it’s part of your attempt to expand the definition of art. Was that your aim?

Your curatorial team at HH Art Spaces brought together established artists like Marina Abramovic and our own Gulammohammed Sheikh alongside artists who don’t even have gallery representation. That’s unusual, isn’t it?

The Biennale also challenges the idea of art as something static or framed. There is Belgium-based Nigerian artist Otobong Nkanga who is growing a garden at Aspinwall and Argentine artist Adrián Villar Rojas who stuffed decaying food into obsolete fridges.

The theme is ‘For the Time Being’. What does ephemerality mean to you in this context?

Kochi itself feels deeply embedded in many of the works. Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama was talking about how he sourced local sacks with the stamps of trade to turn a Mattancherry warehouse—a relic of its mercantile past—into a Parliament of Ghosts. How important was it that artists work closely with the city?

The Biennale positions itself outside the commercial art market, yet collectors are clearly keeping an eye out for promising artists. Are you surprised by that?

I’ve bumped into many locals and tourists here who admit they’ve never been to a gallery before, and many don’t have an ‘arty’ vocabulary. But you’ve spoken about how it’s okay if audiences don’t understand everything.

Finally, what do you think is the function of a Biennale for someone encountering contemporary art for the first time?

There were some grumbles about the spaces opening while many works were still in process. Did that unfinished state bother you?

The Kochi-Muziris Biennale has never been about polished spectacle. Instead of wine and cheese, there are fried banana fritters, a curator dressed in shorts, with some works unfinished and others still finding their rhythm. Neelam Raaj spoke to curatoron why he wanted to blur hierarchies and invite viewers to experience contemporary art as something dynamic rather than fixedWhat interested me here was working with forms that don’t sit neatly in one category. Take the performance of French artist Uriel Barthélém. He is a drummer and composer but his was not just a music performance, it was also an experimental percussion and visual work. The drum kit is programmed to generate visuals, creating a multidimensional, multisensory experience. For me, it was almost like watching a live painting unfold.It was very much about dismantling hierarchy. We wanted to stop working with a pyramid structure where certain artists are placed on pedestals. By placing emerging artists alongside figures with established practices, the intention was to level the playing field and push back against gatekeeping.It allows younger voices to see their own work and research in dialogue with art history and excellence, and to recognise the strength of their own journeys.Yes, art here is meant to be dynamic. Take Otobong’s garden, for example. It’s freshly planted now, but it will grow and change over the course of the Biennale. Time becomes a material. We have three months to cultivate this exhibition, almost like a garden, and that duration allows works to transform.It’s a series of moments. The Biennale has a beginning and an end, an entry and an exit. We’re acknowledging that we’re passing through time and place. Many of us have been living in Kochi for months, treating it as a residence rather than a temporary site. That kind of immersion is essential.Very much so. Many artists sourced materials locally, worked with students, carpenters, craftspeople, and technicians here. We’re crediting everyone involved, and their names will appear alongside the wall texts and in the catalogue. This exhibition was made collectively, with the city.Artists need to sustain their lives. If art can become an agency for them, there’s nothing wrong with it. For me personally, as a performance artist, I never initially thought about my relationship with the market. Over time, drawing became a sustainable practice that fed my performances, and the performances fed the drawings. It became a symbiotic relationship.That openness is crucial. Someone told me they didn’t understand everything, but they understood what they liked, and that was enough. Local residents, international visitors, first-time viewers, and specialists, everyone is invited to experience it on their own terms.This Biennale, in many ways, is about demystifying making, watching, and interacting with art. It’s about instilling faith in the idea that art and poetry are essential to people’s lives. Contemporary art has the ability to poetically approach difficult conversations— about caste, gender, patriarchy, sexuality—within a space that feels safe and open. The aim is to allow people in, to break away from the white cube of galleries, and to make art feel lived, shared, and human.From the beginning, our curatorial note made it clear that we weren’t afraid of inviting people into that process. Some works were still being adjusted, some artists hadn’t fully completed their installations, and that was fine. People could walk through, see what was there, and also sense that things were still being fixed and tuned. Soon, everything will find its place, but the exhibition itself functions as an activation space over time.
Article Summary: The Kochi-Muziris Biennale runs from September 26 to October 1. The theme is ‘For the Time Being’ and the theme is ephemerality. Neelam Raaj spoke to curator Nikhil Chopra on why he wanted to blur hierarchies.

Article Title: India squad for T20 World Cup: Shubman Gill dropped; Ishan Kishan included in 15-member squad
Article Text:
Suryakumar Yadav and Gautam Gambhir (BCCI Photo)

NEW DELHI:

Curious case! Why Ajit Agarkar & Co. continue to ignore Ishan Kishan

Full Squads

India T20Is vs New Zealand:

India T20 World Cup:

Chief selector Ajit Agarkar on Saturday announced India’s squads for the upcoming ICC T20 World Cup and the five-match T20I series against New Zealand. The T20I series will begin on January 21 in Nagpur and will serve as India’s final assignment in the format before the global tournament, scheduled from February 7 to March 8.India have been drawn in Group A for the T20 World Cup, alongside Namibia, the Netherlands, Pakistan, and the United States. The hosts will open their campaign against the USA on February 7 in Mumbai.Despite a lean run with the bat in the recently concluded T20I series against South Africa, which India won 3–1, Suryakumar Yadav has been entrusted with the captaincy for the marquee event. In 20 matches and 18 innings this year, Suryakumar has scored 213 runs at an average of 14.20, striking at just over 125, without registering a single half-century.Suryakumar Yadav (c), Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson (wk), Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Rinku Singh, Harshit Rana, Arshdeep Singh, Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakaravarthy, Washington Sundar, Ishan KishanSuryakumar Yadav (c), Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson (wk), Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Rinku Singh, Harshit Rana, Arshdeep Singh, Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakaravarthy, Washington Sundar, Ishan KishanIndia’s T20 World Cup squad sees some major changes. Notably, Shubman Gill , who was India’s vice-captain in the T20 setup, has been dropped, with all-rounder Axar Patel named as the new vice-captain.Gill had struggled to find form since opening the innings. Brought back into the playing XI as part of the management’s long-term leadership plan, his performances remained underwhelming. In 15 T20 matches since his comeback, Gill has scored 291 runs at an average of 24.25 and a strike rate of 137, failing to register a single fifty.Meanwhile, Sanju Samson, who had performed exceptionally well, including scoring three centuries as an opener, was moved down the order. His Asia Cup performance was mixed, though he finished as India’s third-highest run-scorer with 132 runs, behind Abhishek Sharma (314) and Tilak Varma (213). A solitary outing in Australia at No. 3 yielded little impact, after which Samson was dropped from the playing XI.In the last T20 against South Africa, Samson opened the innings again and scored a solid 37 off 22 balls, giving India a good start. The team management now plans to return to their original composition of playing a wicketkeeper at the top. Consequently, Jitesh Sharma has been dropped, and Ishan Kishan has been drafted as the second keeper.Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh make the T20 World Cup squad, while Shubman Gill and Jitesh Sharma miss out. Kishan comes off a stellar domestic season in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, where he captained Jharkhand to their maiden T20 title. He finished the season as the highest run-scorer, amassing 517 runs in 10 games at an average of 57.44 and a strike rate of 197.
Article Summary: Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh make the T20 World Cup squad, while Shubman Gill and Jitesh Sharma miss out. Suryakumar Yadav has been entrusted with the captaincy for the marquee event. The T20I series will begin on January 21 in Nagpur and will serve as India’s final assignment in the format.

Article Title: Hardik Pandya's monster hit injures cameraman; ice pack, hug follow - WATCH
Article Text:
Hardilk Pandya immediately walked up to check on the cameraman’s well-being after his innings (Image credit: BCCI)

Why the Mumbai Maidans are being ignored? | Bombay Sport Exchange

NEW DELHI: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya produced a blistering display of power-hitting to lead India to a commanding 30-run victory over South Africa in the fifth and final T20I in Ahmedabad on Friday, sealing the five-match series 3-1. Pandya’s explosive knock set the tone as India piled up a daunting 231 for 5.Pandya smashed a 16-ball half-century — the second-fastest by an Indian in T20 internationals — on his way to a stunning 63 off just 25 deliveries. His innings was laced with five boundaries and five towering sixes.The carnage was complemented by Tilak Varma, who continued his rich vein of form with a fluent 73. Together, the duo stitched a punishing 105-run partnership for the fourth wicket that completely wrested momentum away from the visitors.One of Pandya’s massive sixes led to an unexpected moment off the field when the ball struck a cameraman stationed near the boundary.Showing concern beyond the contest, Pandya immediately walked up to check on the cameraman’s well-being after his innings, ensuring he was attended to and even helping apply an ice pack.Pandya also hugged the cameraman, a gesture that quickly went viral and earned widespread praise from fans.In reply, South Africa began positively and remained in the chase as long as Quinton de Kock was at the crease. The left-hander scored a fighting 65, but once he was dismissed, the innings unravelled rapidly. Varun Chakravarthy spun a web around the middle order, claiming four wickets as South Africa lost seven wickets for 81 runs to finish on 201 for 8.Pandya’s all-round impact and match-defining innings earned him the Player of the Match award."Winning games is what you play for and it’s always exciting when your contribution helps the team get over the line. No, I actually didn’t know (he has the second fastest fifty for India) until I got out and went back. Our social media guys told me I was the second-fastest," Pandya said.Watch the video here "My first reaction was, “Ah, I missed the top spot!” But happy that Yuvi pa holds that record. Today I just felt it. I actually told my partner beforehand that I was going to step out first ball and try to hit it for six. I was confident it would come off," he said."The situation suited my style; I backed myself and it worked. I took a calculated risk and thankfully it went my way. I’ve always enjoyed the challenge. No matter how many setbacks you face, the aim is to come back stronger, better, and make a bigger impact. When it all comes together, it feels satisfying. But the journey continues - the preparation, the planning, the hard work never stops," Pandya said.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by 30 runs in the fifth and final T20I in Ahmedabad. All-rounder Hardik Pandya scored 63 off just 25 deliveries. It was the second- fastest half-century by an Indian in T20 internationals.

Article Title: BMC polls: Congress decides to go solo; Uddhav–Raj bonhomie strains MVA
Article Text:
Raj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray (R) (PTI file photo)

NEW DELHI: The Congress on Saturday announced that it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections alone, a decision confirmed by party leader Ramesh Chennithala while speaking to ANI news agency.“We are all ready for the BMC elections . I have come to attend the meeting… Congress has taken a decision to contest the elections alone,” Chennithala said.The announcement comes amid one of the most striking political developments in Mumbai ahead of the polls, the growing proximity between Sena UBT chief Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena supremo Raj Thackeray .Once bitter rivals, the cousins now appear aligned in their belief that losing Mumbai would significantly weaken the broader Thackeray political legacy.For Uddhav Thackeray, winning control of the BMC may be the last major opportunity to reassert political relevance after the 2022 split in the Shiv Sena . For Raj Thackeray, the election is being framed as a battle to safeguard Marathi identity, with the MNS presenting itself as the custodian of Maharashtra's linguistic and cultural character.While no formal announcement has been made yet, the Sena (UBT) and MNS are expected to declare their alliance for the BMC polls next week.Notably, the Congress is part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance in Maharashtra, alongside Uddhav Thackeray’s Shiv Sena (UBT) and Sharad Pawar’s Nationalist Congress Party (NCP - SP).In the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections, the MVA suffered a major setback, losing heavily to the BJP-led Mahayuti alliance, which secured a landslide victory.Polling for BMC's 29 municipal corporations, 32 zilla parishads and 336 panchayat samitis will be held on January 15, with results to be declared the following day on January 16.
Article Summary: The Congress on Saturday announced that it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections alone. Polling for BMC's 29 municipal corporations, 32 zilla parishads and 336 panchayat samitis will be held on January 15, with results to be declared the following day on January 16.

Article Title: Why did Lamarr Wilson commit suicide? Inside the heartbreaking loss of the tech YouTuber who inspired millions
Article Text:
Lamarr Wilson, a well known Los Angeles based tech and lifestyle YouTuber with over 2.11 million subscribers, has died by suicide at 48. His death was confirmed by the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner and a family member. Tributes from Geoff Keighley and fans highlight Wilson’s lasting impact on the tech and creator community.

Lamarr Wilson death leaves a lasting mark on the tech creator community

We the Wilson Family are heart broken with this news of LaMarr's passing as he had so many projects in the making, scheduled and contracted with various tech and media companies requesting his expertise and all of these accomplishments and achievements he could add to his Portfolio as he mentioned on one of his social media platforms.

We have so much love for his manage Team Agents as well all the fans he mentored helped or inspired.

It's heartbreaking that Lamarr Wilson has passed away at age 48. Lamarr was a cornerstone of the LA gaming and tech creator community, and he carried an infectious joy and warmth with him everywhere.

Every conversation with him left me feeling a little more energized. He had a rare ability to lift people up just by being himself. During the pandemic, he was one of the first creators to reach out, wanting to help and be part of Summer Game Fest.

That generosity and spirit meant a great deal to us, and it’s something I’ll always remember. My thoughts are with Lamarr’s family, friends, and everyone whose lives he touched





A highly respected voice in the tech and lifestyle content world, broke out online, the creator community collectively mourned, when news of Lamarr Wilson's death. Coming from Los Angeles, where he lived, and known for his calm delivery, Wilson became a source of clarity and building blocks of his channel and also a relationship with millions of people who turned to him in a rapidly changing digital landscape.According to public records from the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner’s Office, Wilson died at the age of 48 and it wasn't until November 21st, 2025, that his passing was confirmed by his family member, Tony Wilson, in a very subdued Facebook post.Lamarr Wilson's manner of death was determined to be suicide although the exact reason as to why he took such a step is still unknown. Wilson's impact will not be forgotten. With over 2.11 million subscribers, he could not be considered a celebrity, but he was deeply respected.His work with videos was exceptional for being warm, patient and made sure that people could make good decisions when dealing with technology. During the pandemic, he turned his influence into more than just videoTony Wilson wrote, "Geoff Keighley, the host of The Game Awards, called him a central figure in the Los Angeles video game and tech scene, and remembered that he was one of the first people he reached out to for support and to contribute to Summer Game Fest.He added, ".”As the tributes keep pouring in on X, Instagram , Reddit and TikTok it's clear that Lamarr Wilson made a difference in people’s lives. He had a knack for showing up for others, laying out facts without bragging about it, and has given the world a heritage that's all about kindness, wanting to learn more, and community.

Article Title: “Recovery isn’t optional” Why Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt says strength, not size, changed her in 2025
Article Text:
Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt opens up about gaining 15 lbs in 2025 and why strength and recovery mattered more than looks. (Image via Getty)

Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt says the 15-pound gain came from muscle, recovery, and long-term planning

Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt shares structured workouts, consistency advice, and public appearance at AmericaFest 2025

Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt is not playing into the optics game. She is controlling the message herself.Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt shared a candid breakdown of her 2025 fitness journey on social media this week, openly revealing that she gained about 15 pounds over the past year. The admission was not framed as a setback. It was framed as progress. Hunt said the change came from intentional training, metabolic reset, and a shift away from appearance-driven goals.Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt positioned the transformation as a long-term commitment to strength and sustainability. Her post focused on how her body performed, how her energy stabilized, and how patience replaced pressure.“My 2025 fitness goal was simple: become the strongest version of myself, inside and out,” she wrote.Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt made it clear that the year was not about restarting or chasing fast results. She said her approach changed once she prioritized training with intention and respecting recovery.“This year wasn’t about starting over. It was about getting smarter. Training with intention, thinking long-term, and learning that strength, balance, and longevity matter more than chasing quick results. I learned that recovery isn’t optional, it’s part of the work.”Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt later addressed the weight change directly and explained how it happened.“I reset my metabolism, fueled my body on purpose, and slowly recomposed, adding about 15 lbs of muscle since I began this journey.”She added that she stopped centering progress around appearance. Instead, she focused on how her body felt day to day, when to push, and when to pause. Hunt said the result was steadier energy and sharper focus as the year progressed.The post was paired with workout clips and set to music by The Weeknd, reinforcing the message without changing its tone. Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt closed the post by stating she ended the year stronger than she began it.Earlier in the week, Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt shared a separate post labeled “Training Tuesday,” showing an upper-body workout performed outdoors with dumbbells and a mat.“Upper body strength doesn’t have to be complicated. All you need is a set of dumbbells, a mat, and a commitment to show up,” she wrote.“Focus on controlled reps, strong posture, and breathing with intention,quality always beats quantity.”Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt also advised followers to keep workouts simple and repeatable, especially on busy days. She encouraged starting small rather than skipping sessions entirely.Later that week, Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt attended Turning Point USA’s AmericaFest in Phoenix. The event runs Dec. 18–21 at the Phoenix Convention Center and honors the legacy of Charlie Kirk, with programming led by his widow Erika Kirk. Hunt shared brief glimpses of the event on social media.While the Kansas City Chiefs continue to navigate an uneven close to the season under owner Clark Hunt, Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt ended 2025 on her own terms. She defined success by strength gained, habits built, and consistency maintained.“Finishing the year stronger than I started, and remembering that growth never really ends.”
Article Summary: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt shared a candid breakdown of her 2025 fitness journey on social media this week. She openly revealed that she gained about 15 pounds over the past year. Hunt said the change came from intentional training, metabolic reset, and a shift away from appearance-driven goals.

Article Title: ‘It is really painful’: Justin Herbert’s beau Madison Beer gets blunt about mental health and bullying

Madison Beer explains why online hate hits harder on bad mental health days

Madison Beer balances vulnerability, new music, and public life with Justin Herbert

Madison Beer is not sugarcoating it anymore. Justin Herbert’s girlfriend used an Instagram Q&A this week to speak plainly about how online hate affects her mental health, and her words landed hard with fans who are used to seeing polished photos instead of personal fallout.The singer did not frame it as a one-off bad day or a celebrity complaint. She described a recurring struggle, one that changes depending on her emotional state and one that still cuts deep, even after years in the public eye.Beer addressed the topic after a follower asked how she deals with bullying online. She said her response depends on how grounded she feels that day and whether life outside social media feels stable.“If I'm feeling good in my personal life, having a good day etc, it's much easier for me to brush it off and focus on what's really in front of me these days, which is growth I'm really proud of,” Beer wrote. “But we all know the truth is most days aren't perfect like that. I struggle with my mental health a lot, so it is really painful to go online and read so much negativity about yourself, for anyone. But especially when you are already struggling.She also pushed back on the idea that public figures should simply accept cruelty as part of the job. Beer asked people to think about the weight of what they post and reminded followers that everyone is dealing with something unseen.“It shouldn't matter if someone is struggling or not / wish people were kinder. It's so easy to think but just do really wish people would take the weight of their words, that we've all just human beings living life for the first time and not every opinion u have needs to be shared. Everyone is dealing with something and I don't personally wanna take part in just attacking or ripping others apart just because I could.”Beer added that grounding herself in her own identity and leaning on people who know her personally helps, even though the judgment never fully disappears.The Q&A came just one day after Beer posted photos teasing her upcoming album, Locket, which is set to release on Jan. 16. She captioned the post, “My album comes out in one month,” signaling a major professional moment running parallel to a very personal admission.Beer has previously spoken about feeling supported in her relationship with Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert. On the “Call Her Daddy podcast” on Dec. 10, she described the stability she feels behind the scenes.“I feel like taken care of in a way that I can break down and like I have someone to lean on,” Beer said. “And I think that’s important.”The couple publicly confirmed their relationship on Oct. 5 with a sideline kiss during the Chargers’ game against the Washington Commanders. Since then, Beer has appeared at games and shared glimpses into Herbert’s life away from football, including a recent visit to his family’s animal farm in Oregon.The timing matters. Beer is preparing to release deeply personal music while also navigating the scrutiny that comes with dating a franchise quarterback. Her comments suggest that public visibility does not dull the impact of online cruelty. If anything, it amplifies it.For fans who consume celebrity lives in clips and captions, Beer’s message cuts through that distance. The hate does not stay on the screen. It follows people offline.

The singer did not frame it as a one-off bad day or a celebrity complaint. She described a recurring struggle, one that changes depending on her emotional state and one that still cuts deep.

Auston Matthews continues to win faceoffs, backcheck, and handle defensive responsibility. Yet Toronto pays him to swing games offensively. At five-on-five, his line has not consistently owned shifts. On the power play, the dominance that once felt automatic has faded into predictability. The looks are there, but the finish has gone missing.That gap between effort and outcome feeds scrutiny. In Toronto, leadership is judged through goals when the stakes rise. When scoring dries up, every shift becomes a test of authority and legacy. Nick Kypreos tried to strike a more hopeful tone in the Toronto Star, but optimism struggles to breathe when results lag behind reputation.The coaching staff has searched for answers. Different wingers, altered looks, and tactical tweaks have come and gone. The puck still moves well, but the instinctive scoring touch that defined Matthews has not returned with consistency. There is also quiet talk of tension with coach Craig Berube, another layer that complicates an already delicate situation.Trading a captain in his prime is not standard practice. Neither is standing still while doubt grows inside a contender. Toronto management now faces a narrow path where action and inaction both carry consequences. Whether Berger’s report proves prophetic or premature, it captures how fragile this stretch feels.Matthews remains elite. Yet in this market, elite alone no longer settles the noise. The next few months will decide more than standings. They will define how this era is remembered, and whether Auston Matthews and Toronto find clarity together or part under pressure.Also Read: Are Auston Matthews and Craig Berube drifting apart as Maple Leafs struggles spark tense locker-room speculation?

Auston Matthews still generates chances, still competes hard in all three zones, but goals no longer arrive with the same inevitability. You need to get up onto pole position ,and sometimes the rest of your career just follows.It’s a psychological breakthrough as much as anything.”Britain is currently enjoying a golden era in middle-distance running. Wightman ended a 38-year wait for a men’s 1500m world title in 2022. Kerr followed by winning the world championship a year later. Both victories echoed the dominance of Coe’s own era.While Hoggins looks to the future, another British runner has already come close to Coe’s record. At the 2025 World Championships in Tokyo, Max Burgin ran a personal best of 1:42.29. That time was just 0.56 seconds away from the legendary mark.The race was described by Coe as a “proper, proper 800m race.” It was fast from the opening lap. The pace helped push Burgin to a new level. After the race, Burgin said he now feels “comfortable at that low 1:42” and added that it “makes sense next year to be pushing to those 1:41s.”That performance showed the record is no longer safe. With Burgin closing in and Hoggins earning Coe’s trust, British athletics may finally be approaching a historic run.Also Read: Adam Peaty and Holly Ramsay escape to Lapland for holidays ahead of wedding amid family drama and swimmer’s mom's 60th birthday
Article Summary: Sebastian Coe has publicly praised British middle-distance star Ben Hoggins. Coe’s British 800-metre record of 1:41.73, set in 1981, has stood for almost 50 years. The World Athletics President has rarely spoken so openly about a young British runner. Another British runner, Max Burgin, has already come close to the record.

Article Title: Toronto Maple Leafs' Craig Berube calls power play “God Awful” after 4-0 loss to Washington Capitals
Article Text:
Toronto Maple Leafs Craig Berube

Maple Leafs' power play ranks third-last in NHL after loss to Washington Capitals

NHL Highlights | Maple Leafs vs. Capitals - December 18, 2025

Head coach Craig Berube isn’t happy with the performance against Washington Capitals

The Toronto Maple Leafs suffered a humiliating 4-0 shutout loss to the Washington Capitals on Thursday night. The defeat exposed numerous flaws throughout the lineup, but none more glaring than the power play.Head coach Craig Berube didn't mince words when addressing his team's performance on the power play. Toronto entered Thursday's game sitting 30th in the NHL with a power play operating at just 15 percent.After failing to convert on five opportunities against Washington, that number dropped to 14 percent. Only the Calgary Flames rank lower at 13.8 percent. The Maple Leafs have scored a league-worst 12 goals on 85 power play opportunities this season.No other team in the NHL has scored fewer goals with the man advantage despite Toronto's elite offensive talent. The franchise that once operated one of the deadliest power plays in hockey now looks completely lost when given an extra skater.Back in the 2022-23 season, opponents feared taking penalties against Toronto. The Maple Leafs made teams pay consistently with their lethal combination of skill and execution.Now, the opposite holds. When Toronto goes to the man advantage, their opponents become almost immortal.The Leafs struggle to generate shots on net, and half the time they can't even gain entry into the offensive zone. Berube delivered a scathing assessment of the power play following Thursday's shutout"The power play has actually been getting better, but tonight it was god-awful, in my opinion," the coach said bluntly. He acknowledged the second unit created some chances but reserved his harshest criticism for the top unit."Our top unit didn't execute, didn't win any battles when they needed to, just couldn't make plays," Berube stated. The numbers tell a damning story. Toronto tallied just five shots during five power play opportunities throughout the entire game.The lack of offensive zone time and quality chances made Washington's penalty kill look effortless. When asked whether personnel changes might be necessary, Berube didn't rule anything out. "Yeah, it could be. Yeah, for sure. That's something we'll definitely look at," he confirmed.The admission signals potential shakeups could be coming to a unit that features former Rocket Richard Trophy winner Auston Matthews, runner-up William Nylander, and 38-goal scorer John Tavares. Matthew Knies, Morgan Rielly, and Oliver Ekman-Larsson round out the options.For a team with that much firepower, power-play goals should come easily. Instead, Toronto's man advantage has become a liability that opponents no longer fear. Unless something changes dramatically, the Maple Leafs' championship aspirations will continue being derailed by their inability to capitalize on the most basic advantage in hockey.
Article Summary: Maple Leafs' power play ranks third-last in NHL after loss to Washington Capitals. Head coach Craig Berube didn't mince words when addressing his team's performance. Toronto entered Thursday's game sitting 30th in the NHL with a power play operating at just 15 percent.

Article Title: “Never tip if you don't want to”: Asmongold blasts tipping culture following viral confrontation involving Wendy Ortiz’s sister

Article Title: Tampa Bay Rays eye major three-team trade with Astros and Pirates featuring Brandon Lowe: Report
Article Text:
Tampa Bay Rays eye major three-team trade with Astros and Pirates featuring Brandon Lowe: Report (Image Via Getty)

Brandon Lowe headline piece in Rays, Astros, and Pirates trade talks

“If completed, outfielder Jacob Melton and right-hander Anderson Brito would head to the Rays.”

Brandon Lowe could be on the move soon. The Tampa Bay Rays are in active talks on a possible three-team trade with the Houston Astros and the Pittsburgh Pirates, according to reports on Wednesday from The Athletic. The deal is still being discussed, but it could change all three rosters before the MLB offseason moves forward.The talks involve power, pitching, and young talent. If completed, the trade would send Brandon Lowe out of Tampa Bay after several strong seasons. It would also give Houston pitching help and allow Pittsburgh to add a much-needed bat to its lineup.According to The Athletic reporters Chandler Rome and Ken Rosenthal, the current framework sends Brandon Lowe from the Tampa Bay Rays to the Pittsburgh Pirates. Lowe is 31 years old and has been one of Tampa Bay’s top hitters when healthy.In the 2025 season, Brandon Lowe hit .256 with 31 home runs and 83 RBIs. He remained one of the best power-hitting second basemen in baseball.Since 2019, only Marcus Semien and Jose Altuve have more home runs at the position. The Pirates are looking for offense after struggling to score runs last season.Brandon Lowe would give them power in the middle of the order right away.Pittsburgh would also receive Rays outfielder Jake Mangum and left-handed pitcher Mason Montgomery if the deal goes through.Lowe’s contract runs through the 2026 season, which makes this a key decision point for Tampa Bay as it looks to balance payroll and long-term planning.In the same deal, the Pittsburgh Pirates would send right-handed pitcher Mike Burrows to the Houston Astros.Mike Burrows is 26 years old and posted a 3.94 ERA during the 2025 season. Houston is looking to add pitching depth after dealing with injuries and workload issues.Tampa Bay would receive Astros outfield prospect Jacob Melton and right-handed pitcher Anderson Brito. Ken Rosenthal reported,Jacob Melton is viewed as a strong young outfield prospect with upside. Anderson Brito gives Tampa Bay another arm to develop. The Rays are known for building depth through trades like this.There is still work to be done. Talks are ongoing, and nothing is final yet. Tampa Bay has also been linked to Arizona Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte, which suggests backup plans are in place if this deal falls apart.Also Read: MLB Trade Rumors: White Sox Eye Power Upgrade In Munetaka Murakami As Experts Predict Bo Bichette 2B Transition

If completed, the trade would send Brandon Lowe out of Tampa Bay after several strong seasons.

Article Title: Macklin Celebrini surpasses Wayne Gretzky’s teenage NHL point record at the age of 19, now sets sights on Sidney Crosby
Article Text:
Macklin Celebrini breaks Wayne Gretzky’s teenage record (Image via: Getty Images)

Macklin Celebrini breaks Wayne Gretzky’s teenage points record, now eyes Sidney Crosby ’s mark



Macklin Celebrini has officially stepped into rare NHL territory, and he has done it in a way that feels both ruthless and inevitable. The San Jose Sharks’ 19-year-old sensation has moved past Wayne Gretzky in the NHL record books for teenage scoring before Christmas, and that alone tells you the scale of what he is doing this season. This is not hype; it is production backed by consistency.With two more assists on Thursday, Celebrini climbed to 18 goals and 35 assists through 35 games, pushing his tally to 53 points before the holiday break. Gretzky, back in the 1980-81 season, had 51 points as a teenager. Passing a name like Gretzky is never a casual headline in the NHL, but Celebrini has made it feel like part of his natural progression.Celebrini’s surge does not sit in isolation. He has stacked 10 points in his last four games, which speaks to rhythm, confidence, and a clear command of the NHL pace. He is closing in on another benchmark too. Sidney Crosby owns the modern mark with 55 points before Christmas as a teenager, and with two games left for San Jose before the break, Celebrini has a very real shot to leap past that as well. The opportunity begins Saturday when the Sharks meet the Seattle Kraken, and at this stage, it hardly matters who the opponent is. Celebrini has shown he can control games against anyone.After posting 63 points in 70 games as a rookie, Celebrini has accelerated sharply in year two with 53 points in just 35 games. That is star-level efficiency. It signals growth, maturity, and an offensive ceiling that continues to stretch higher. Watching him now, it feels less like a breakout and more like a player settling into who he is supposed to become: one of the best forwards in the league.Breaking Gretzky’s teenage pace would be enough to define a season for most players. For Celebrini, it looks like another checkpoint. With this trajectory, it is difficult to imagine this being the last historic mark he pushes aside.
Article Summary: Macklin Celebrini has broken Wayne Gretzky’s teenage points record. The 19-year- old has scored 53 points in 35 games this season. Sidney Crosby owns the modern mark with 55 points before Christmas as a teenager. With two games left for San Jose before the break, Celebrini could leap past that as well.

Article Title: IND vs SA: Unbeaten run rolls on! Gautam Gambhir's India clinch 5th T20I, seal series 3–1
Article Text:
India's head coach Gautam Gambhir, players Hardik Pandya and Sanju Samson after the team's victory (PTI Photo/Shashank Parade)

Why the Mumbai Maidans are being ignored? | Bombay Sport Exchange

NEW DELHI: India ended the T20I series against South Africa on a high by winning the fifth and final match and sealing the five-match series 3-1 on Friday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.With this win, India have managed to extend their unbeaten streak. They are now on a streak of 10 consecutive series wins (including major tournaments).With the 4th T20I in Lucknow being abandoned earlier because of heavy fog, everyone wanted to see a full game, and the players didn't disappoint at all.India put up a big total of 231 for 5 after South Africa won the toss and chose to bowl.The batting effort was led by Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya . Tilak played a steady and attacking knock, scoring 73 runs off 42 balls.Hardik provided the late surge with a quick 63 off just 25 balls, hitting five 4s and five 6s. Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma also gave India a strong start at the top.Chasing 232, South Africa began well. Quinton de Kock was in fine form and attacked the Indian bowlers from the start. South Africa matched India’s Powerplay score and stayed in the hunt.When Dewald Brevis joined de Kock, the visitors picked up momentum. The pair played freely and took South Africa to 118 runs at the halfway mark, putting pressure back on the Indian side.At that point, the match seemed evenly balanced. That is when India captain Suryakumar Yadav turned to his most trusted bowler, Jasprit Bumrah . Bumrah made an immediate impact by dismissing de Kock with a sharp return catch. That wicket changed the game.South Africa suddenly lost their rhythm. From 120 for 1, they slipped to 135 for 5 in a short span.The middle order could not recover from the collapse. Varun Chakaravarthy added to South Africa’s problems with an impressive spell, picking up four wickets and breaking key partnerships.While Varun took the wickets, Bumrah’s spell stood out in a high-scoring match. He finished with excellent figures of 2 wickets for just 17 runs in his four overs, controlling the game when it mattered most.South Africa eventually finished on 201/8 in their 20 overs, falling 30 runs short of the target.With this victory, India won the match by 30 runs and closed the series 3-1. Hardik Pandya, who also took one wicket during his bowling, has been named the Man of the Match.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by 30 runs in the fifth and final T20I in Ahmedabad. India won the five-match series 3-1. India are now on a streak of 10 consecutive series wins. Hardik Pandya was named the Man of the Match.

Article Title: Jerry Jones breaks silence on Trevon Diggs situation and Cowboys coaching outlook
Article Text:
Image via Getty

Jerry Jones downplays Trevon Diggs exit speculation

The Mavs & Stars Both Picked Up Wins Last Night; Previewing Cowboys/Chargers | FAN CAM 12/19/25

Coaching stability remains Jerry Jones’ priority

Also Read:

Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones has finally addressed two of the most pressing questions surrounding the franchise: Trevon Diggs’ uncertain future and the team’s coaching direction, as the Cowboys limp toward the end of a disappointing season.With playoff hopes nearly extinguished and internal tensions surfacing, Jones’ comments offer rare clarity on where the organization currently stands.Speaking on 105.3 The FAN, Jones pushed back against growing speculation that Trevon Diggs may have played his final snap in a Cowboys uniform. The Pro Bowl cornerback has not featured since Week 6 and remains on injured reserve, despite recent claims that he is healthy enough to return.“I think that’s a stretch to put that thing that far out,” Jones said, attempting to cool the narrative surrounding Diggs’ long-term future. “On my basis, looking at his situation, I don’t have that kind of attitude about him.”Diggs’ absence has been layered with complexity. While the team has cited health and practice performance as factors, Diggs himself has publicly expressed frustration, stating that the decision to keep him sidelined is no longer in his control.Reports of behind-the-scenes tension, particularly related to scheme fit and rehabilitation preferences have only fueled uncertainty.With a looming deadline to activate Diggs off injured reserve, Dallas must decide whether to bring him back for the final stretch or shut him down for the season. Regardless, Jones’ remarks suggest the Cowboys are not yet prepared to close the door on the All-Pro cornerback.While Diggs’ situation remains fluid, Jones was far more definitive when discussing the Cowboys’ coaching outlook. Despite the team’s struggles and a record hovering around .500, Jones voiced strong confidence in head coach Brian Schottenheimer’s leadership.“He’s had an outstanding year,” Jones said. “He’s technically as sound as you can draw up. We like his philosophy of how to play football.”Jones highlighted the adversity Schottenheimer has faced from injuries to roster instability, and praised his ability to manage multiple responsibilities, including play-calling duties. The endorsement signals continuity rather than upheaval, even as fans clamor for major changes.Jones’ comments underline a broader reality in Dallas: the Cowboys are not planning a dramatic reset just yet. Instead, the franchise appears committed to internal evaluation rather than sweeping change.However, unresolved questions remain. Diggs’ relationship with the coaching staff, defensive scheme compatibility, and overall roster health will shape the offseason narrative. Meanwhile, Schottenheimer’s long-term security may depend on how convincingly Dallas finishes the year.For now, Jones’ message is clear, patience over panic. Whether that approach resonates with fans or yields results on the field is a different matter entirely.
Article Summary: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones downplays Trevon Diggs exit speculation. Jones also voiced strong confidence in head coach Brian Schottenheimer. Jones’ comments underline a broader reality in Dallas: the Cowboys are not planning a dramatic reset just yet.
